intro: Oenanthe tricholoba, commonly known as the hairy cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which are typically lance-shaped and have a distinct scent. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Oenanthe tricholoba is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in wet meadows.
